title: NewsNews
content:
Julia Wandelt and Karen Spragg deny stalking Kate and Gerry McCann over several years.

The jury in the trial of Deng Majek is shown CCTV and told he carried out a "vicious and frenzied attack".

Fives vehicles parked outside houses in Barmouth Drive were destroyed in a suspected arson attack.

Residents were offered thousands to sell their land and withdraw previous objections to the project.

Buttons, Bueno, Yorkie and Malteser were among 455 animals seized from a Skegby farm.

The jury in the trial of Deng Majek is shown CCTV and told he carried out a "vicious and frenzied attack".

Yoni Findlay, hit by a police bullet as officers responded to the attack, is released from hospital.

Tesco has told customers affected by a petrol station fuel pump mix-up to get in touch.

Fives vehicles parked outside houses in Barmouth Drive were destroyed in a suspected arson attack.

A spokesperson for the nursery says an employee is suspended and police are investigating.

The undercover policing inquiry heard the Met began surveillance of the Lawrences after their son's murder.

Kae Burnell-Chambers said she needed a stick to walk, but was seen attending body painting events.

Tony Caunter, who played Roy Evans in the BBC soap, died in Eastbourne on Monday, his family says.

The British Museum hopes to secure the pendant, found by a metal detectorist in Warwickshire.

Ben Hatcher is pulled on to the stage by his childhood idol during her concert in Sheffield.

Woman praises "absolute heroes" at Guernsey Waste for hunting for her missing rings.

Amy Sharp's Alaskan Malamute Mal is more than twice the average size of a dog of his breed.

Six months on from the government taking control of Scunthorpe's steelworks, what is the mood?

Nadia Yahlom says she had the "right to take a stance about genocide" by removing ribbons.

Dominic Robinson says he discovered crockery on the wreck below the surface of the Celtic Sea.

A UK firm says other sellers are lifting its photos of steel ornaments to sell similar products.

Tests show a road surface enhanced with graphene is outperforming regular asphalt.

The 125m (137yd) tunnel is launched 19 months ago and arrives in Birmingham in October.

A "scream club" hosted its first London event at Primrose Hill last weekend.

Three women from the South are hoping to highlight important causes as part of the competition.

Police footage shows the suspects get caught by a stinger, pile out of the car and run off.

Police footage shows the suspects get caught by a stinger, pile out of the car and run off.

Former England bowler Stuart Broad believes Australia have their "worst" team since 2010 heading into this winter's Ashes.

Kevin de Bruyne is in sparkling form for Napoli and Belgium this season - did he leave Man City too soon?

The spotlight is on Beau Greaves after her landmark win over Luke Littler on Monday, but who is the 21-year-old from Doncaster?

Britain's Emma Raducanu struggles physically in a three-set loss to world number 219 Zhu Lin in the Ningbo Open first round.

Some parents say help is not available quickly enough to deal with violence from their children.

Corsham in Wiltshire has been transformed for the filming of the latest series.

A parliamentary inquiry will look at reflective "ghost" plates, which cannot be read by cameras.

New information screens and USB sockets are added to more than 1,000 carriages.

National Highways says emergency resurfacing works have now been completed following a vehicle fire.

The club has announced a rugby league development agreement with North Lincolnshire Council.

Patients say they could have lived normal lives if they had been tested sooner.

Actor Stephen Finegold says his career 'stood him in good stead' to work as a magistrate.
